p: When infection rate per contact Î² increases, so does the variance of tree features, and the following tree features increase on average: Colless index, Sackin index, IL numbers (nodes with single tip child), average ladder size, maximum height, average pathlength, Wiener index and diameter. The number of cherries, pitchforks and maximal closeness decrease with increasing infection rate, as shown in Fig 3 for the skewed-clustered network.
